author: ANI
title: Nicaragua: Second Bishop arrested in escalating crackdown on Catholic Church â€“ ThePrint â€“ ANIFeed
text:
Home World Nicaragua: Second Bishop arrested in escalating crackdown on Catholic Church World Nicaragua: Second Bishop arrested in escalating crackdown on Catholic Church ANI 24 December, 2023 12:47 pm IST Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Linkedin Representative Image (Photo Credit: Reuters) Text Size: A- A+
Managua [Nicaragua], December 24 (ANI): Nicaraguan authorities apprehended a second bishop on Thursday (local time) in an extensive crackdown on opposition figures and the Catholic Church led by President Daniel Ortegaâ€™s government, CNN reported, citing sources.
Bishop Isidoro Mora, from the Siuna church on the Caribbean coast, was arrested after participating in a mass commemorating the anniversary of the Matagalpa church, the sources added.
Show Full Article
CNN has sought further details on Moraâ€™s legal situation and arrest from the Nicaraguan government.
A source, requesting anonymity due to potential backlash, witnessed the moments leading up to the arrest and mentioned that Mora had briefly discussed detained bishop and government critic Rolando Alvarez during a homily. Mora was quoted as saying, â€œWe are here praying for Matagalpa church, praying for Bishop Rolando,â€ adding, â€œUnfortunately, (Mora) was arrested the next day.â€
Alvarez, the bishop of Matagalpa, is serving a 26-year prison sentence for charges including conspiracy and treason. He refused to leave the country with 200 others opposing the government.
The condition of Mora since the arrest remains unknown, as per one source.
The other source told CNN the â€œpersecution against the church in Nicaragua is very strong. We shut up because if we say something we face threats. We know the world knows, but we suffer the pain.â€
Since 2018, tens of thousands of Nicaraguans have fled the country to escape persecution when Ortegaâ€™s government suppressed widespread anti-regime protests, resulting in numerous deaths, injuries, and arbitrary detentions, according to Human Rights Watch.
Ortega and Vice President Rosario Murillo view the Catholic Church as opposition forces, labelling the protests as an â€œattempted coup.â€
Moraâ€™s arrest follows the expulsion of two Costa Rican nuns from Nicaragua in April after praying for Alvarez.
Yader Morazan, an expert in Nicaraguaâ€™s judiciary system, highlighted a â€œrepressive patternâ€ against the Catholic Church, with dozens of priests and laymen jailed, and over 200 people, including priests and nuns, expelled or blocked from returning.
A news release from state-owned website El19digital on Monday reported the arrest of 11 people linked to Christian organisations accused of money laundering.
Ortega secured a fifth term as president in 2021. His government, citing a vague national security law, began detaining opposition figures, journalists, and activists ahead of the elections in June of that year, CNN reported. (ANI)
This report is auto-generated from ANI news service. ThePrint holds no responsibility for its content.

author: @UN_News_Centre
title: UN forum on sustainable development concludes with renewed commitment, call for urgent action | UN News
text: The High-Level Political Forum (HLPF) on Sustainable Development concluded on Wednesday, with nations reiterating the need for renewed impetus and accelerated actions to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by the 2030 deadline. Held under the auspices of the UN Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC), the Forum took place from 8 to 17 July . This yearâ€™s theme was Reinforcing the 2030 Agenda and eradicating poverty in times of multiple crises: the effective delivery of sustainable, resilient and innovative solutions. The session included a three-day ministerial segment from 15 to 17 July as part of the High-Level Segment of the Council. Key votes on ministerial declaration The adoption of a ministerial declaration , a key outcome of the Forum, was marked by robust debate among Member States, culminating in two key votes on amendments. One proposal involved the inclusion of a paragraph â€œstrongly urgingâ€ States to refrain from promulgating and applying any unilateral economic, financial or trade measures not in accordance with international law and the UN Charter that impede the full achievement of economic and social development, in particular in developing countries. The inclusion â€“ proposed among others by Belarus, Cuba, Iran, Russia and Syria â€“ was agreed with a recorded vote of 105 nations in favour, 11 against and 46 abstentions. The other amendment, proposed by Israel called for the deletion of a paragraph that â€œrecognizedâ€ that sustainable development cannot be realized without peace and security, and peace and security will be at risk without sustainable development. That paragraph also called for â€œfurther effective measures and actionsâ€ to be taken, in conformity with international law, to remove the obstacles to the full realization of the right to self-determination of peoples living under colonial and foreign occupation, which continue to adversely affect their economic and social development as well as the environment. In a recorded vote, the Forum decided to retain this paragraph, with 122 Member States voting for retention and two voting for deletion (Israel and United States). Thirty-nine States abstained. The ministerial declaration , as amended, was then adopted without a vote. Commitment renewed Addressing the Forum after the adoption, Paula NarvÃ¡ez, ECOSOC President, highlighted that the ministerial declaration â€œreinforced once againâ€ the urgency of implementing the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. â€œThis high-level political forum has highlighted that it is not too late to make sustainable development a reality.â€ She also recognized the efforts of Ambassador JosÃ© Blanco of the Dominican Republic and Ambassador Merete Fjeld Brattested of Norway for their leadership as facilitators of â€œcomplex negotiations, which were conducted in an exceptional, transparent and inclusive mannerâ€. Complex, inclusive negotiations She added that delegations negotiated for over 70 hours, with 20 informal and 3 informal-informal sessions, â€œmaking every effort to bring together the different opposing positions and present an ambitious and balanced documentâ€. The ECOSOC President concluded by stressing the bodyâ€™s collective resolve to accelerate the implementation of SDGs and advance sustainable development, and to undertake the transformations necessary to achieve that objective. â€œWe will continue to renew multilateral efforts to fulfil the promise of the 2030 Agenda and leave no one behind,â€ she said.

author: @Clint_Anderson1 Clint Anderson
title: Does "ujust setup-virtualization" command doesnt work?
text:
Wanted to setup a VM with â€œujust setup-virtualizationâ€ but after i tried to â€œEnable Virtualizationâ€ nothing happens?
Update within the hour or two and it should be fixed.
Iâ€™m having the same issue. What caused the recipe to break?
Recent commits that changed the recipe slightly broke it, but it has been fixed recently and Bazzite is currently building right now.
Being new to Bazzite, do I simply use the command ujust update to update things?
Yup that will update your system.
Edit: bad news the fix isnâ€™t in the image yet but there is a temp workaround.
The new commit used a different method to check if virt-manager was installed, however it turns out it was unreliable and did not work on all installations (it worked on my main machine i tested it on, but didnt work for other people)
virt-manager
I PRed a fix for it last night however, a new image has not been successfully built with the fix due to package skews.
You can use this command temporarily to setup virtualization
curl -Lo /tmp/virt.just https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ublue-os/bazzite/main/system_files/desktop/shared/usr/share/ublue-os/just/84-bazzite-virt.just ; just -f /tmp/virt.just setup-virtualization
It will download the newerst 84-bazzite-virt.just and run setup-virtualization on that.
84-bazzite-virt.just
setup-virtualization
maybe dumb suggestion but is libvirt popular enough that maybe it should just be included in the base image with like, guestfstools or something
i donâ€™t THINK it interferes with other solutions like virtualbox/vmware/etc

author: VNExplorer
title: Indiaâ€™s Coldest Desert Is Now Too Hot To Handle, Airlines Announce Mass Cancellation As Temp Rises
text: leh ladakh indiaâ€™s coldest desert is now too hot to handle, airlines announce mass cancellation as temp rises Ladakh: Leh-Ladakh, once famously known as Indiaâ€™s Coldest desert has now become too hot to handle as day-time temperature increased to 35 degrees Celsius. Several Indian airlines have announced mass cancellation of flights. Several passengers are reported to be stranded at the Leh airport, claimed users on X(formally Twitter) adding that almost 12 flights have been cancelled in the past three days. IndiGo cancelled flight bookings on its website till July 31. In a post on X, the airline, on Monday announced a refund to passengers affected by the cancellation, it wrote, â€œHigh ground temperatures and runway restrictions in #Leh have necessitated the cancellation of all flights for today. If you wish to re-book or claim a refund, visit https://bit.ly/3MxSLeE We regret the inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.â€ Flight cancellations due to extreme weather conditions have become common in Leh-Ladakh. However, this is the first time that mass flight cancellations have occurred because of unbearably high daytime temperatures. The low air density at high altitudes, like in Leh, can degrade aircraft engine performance, reported TOI. As altitude increases, air temperatures drop, and air pressure decreases, causing air molecules to expand and lowering overall air density. This reduction in air density means there is less oxygen available, which is why mountaineers use oxygen cylinders at high altitudes. Leh airport is located over 14,000 feet above sea level, which poses significant challenges for aircraft operations compared to other places in the country. The air pressure in Leh is naturally lower year-round, and any abnormal increase in temperature can further decrease air density. Thin air density impacts aircraft engine performance, particularly during climbing and landing phases, as the engines must generate higher speeds to stay aloft. Under such challenging conditions, coupled with unusual temperatures, aircraft engines may not be able to produce enough thrust to carry a commercially viable load, according to TOI.
